page.title: 15THE REX CINEMA
page.content: The Rex was built in{1936 by W.W. {Stansby}primarily as a cinema but with facilities for theatre productions. At present it is run by{John Stansby}with his brother organizing the bookings. After the war the role of the Rex in the community began to change because of the{increased popularity in {television.}The{video market}has made the cinema trade{decline}even more and now people only go to the cinema for its special atmosphere. At present the Rex can hold{876 people{(338 in the circle and 538 in {the stalls)}but this will be cut to {300}when the theatre is closed and the screen is moved forward. These cutbacks are due to the large overhead costs, competition from the{Wilmslow {Leisure Centre}who now have facilities to stage theatre productions and the {Palace(Manchester) re-opened in 1982.
